Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 5th overall pick, by Minnesota in 1969...
Injured on 6/21/1969 with a Stiff Neck, out for 6 days...
Injured on 9/1/1970 with a Bruised Hand, out for 3 days...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/1/1972, off Marty Pattin (OAK)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/18/1972, off Herm Starrette (BOS)...
Drove in 6 runs against Boston on 6/27/1973...
Drove in 6 runs against Chicago (A) on 8/10/1973...
Traded from Minnesota to San Francisco on 7/14/1977 (Going to SF: P D. Lewallyn, P M. Fidrych, SS R. Washington, LF L. Fritz, LF M. Rivers. Going to MIN: 1B B. Robertson)...
Was selected to the 1979 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against New York (N) on 5/28/1980...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/9/1982, hitting .560 with 0 HR, 7 RBI...
Injured on 9/13/1982 with a Inflamed Anterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 4-5 weeks...
